package.name: com.nokia.QtDev-i686-w64-Npackd-Release
package.title: Qt for MinGW-w64 32 bit release mode for Npackd
package.description:
C++ library (development). This library will be used to build Npackd itself.
The installation will create a symbolic link to the directory in C:\NpackdSymlinks. This symbolic link should be used instead of the installation directory instead as a Qt build cannot be easily moved to another directory.
Please note that you have to define an appropriate toolchain in Qt Creator first before defining a new Qt build there. Otherwise adding a new Qt in the configuration dialog would just not work without any error message (Qt Creator 2.6.1)
Compiling Qt for Npackd: 1. install mingw-w64 32 bit 2. install Qt sources 3. install ActivePerl 4. copy Qt sources to c:\Libs\com.nokia.QtDev-i686-w64-Npackd-4.8.2 (replace the version number by the version of this package) 5. set path=%mingww64%\bin;%activeperl%\bin 6. Run the configure command as shown below configure.exe -opensource -confirm-license -release -static -no-qt3support -no-opengl -no-dsp -no-vcproj -no-dbus -no-phonon -no-phonon-backend -no-multimedia -no-webkit -no-script -no-scripttools -no-declarative -nomake examples -nomake demos -nomake tests -no-style-plastique -no-style-cleanlooks -no-style-motif -no-style-cde -qt-style-windowsvista -qt-style-windowsxp 7. mingw32-make.exe 8. mingw32-make.exe clean
Software used to built particular versions of this package: * 4.8.2: MinGW-w64 32 bit 4.7.2; Qt 4.8.2; ActivePerl 5.14.2.1402

package.name: com.nokia.QtDev-x86_64-w64-Npackd-Release
package.title: Qt for MinGW-w64 64 bit release mode for Npackd
package.description:
C++ library (development). This library will be used to build Npackd itself.
The installation will create a symbolic link to the directory in C:\NpackdSymlinks. This symbolic link should be used instead of the installation directory instead as a Qt build cannot be easily moved to another directory.
Please note that you have to define an appropriate toolchain in Qt Creator first before defining a new Qt build there. Otherwise adding a new Qt in the configuration dialog would just not work without any error message (Qt Creator 2.6.1)
Compiling Qt for Npackd: 1. install mingw-w64 64 bit 2. install Qt sources 3. install ActivePerl 4. copy Qt sources to c:\Libs\com.nokia.QtDev-x86_64-w64-Npackd-4.8.2 (replace the version number by the version of this package) 5. set path=%mingww64%\bin;%activeperl%\bin 6. configure.exe -opensource -confirm-license -release -static -no-qt3support -no-opengl -no-dsp -no-vcproj -no-dbus -no-phonon -no-phonon-backend -no-multimedia -no-webkit -no-script -no-scripttools -no-declarative -nomake examples -nomake demos -nomake tests -no-style-plastique -no-style-cleanlooks -no-style-motif -no-style-cde -qt-style-windowsvista -qt-style-windowsxp 7. mingw32-make.exe 8. mingw32-make.exe clean
Software used to built particular versions of this package: * 4.8.2: MinGW-w64 64 bit 4.7.2; Qt 4.8.2; ActivePerl 5.14.2.1402

package.name: net.sourceforge.quazip.QuaZIPSource
package.title: QuaZIP
package.description: Qt based library to access ZIP archives (source code)

package.name: org.boost.Boost
package.title: Boost
package.description: set of C++ general purpose libraries (source code)

package.name: org.xapian.XapianCore
package.title: Xapian core
package.description: search engine library in C++ (source code)

version.file:
if "%npackd_cl%" equ "" set npackd_cl=..\com.googlecode.windows-package-manager.NpackdCL-1 set onecmd="%npackd_cl%\npackdcl.exe" "path" "--package=org.7-zip.SevenZIPA" "--versions=[9.20, 9.20]" for /f "usebackq delims=" %%x in (`%%onecmd%%`) do set sevenzipa=%%x
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.7z') do set setup=%%x "%sevenzipa%\7za.exe" x "%setup%" del "%setup%"
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b 4.*') do set name=%%x cd "%name%" for /f "delims=" %%a in ('dir /b') do ( move "%%a" .. ) cd .. rmdir "%name%"

if "%npackd_cl%" equ "" set npackd_cl=..\com.googlecode.windows-package-manager.NpackdCL-1 set onecmd="%npackd_cl%\npackdcl.exe" "path" "--package=org.7-zip.SevenZIPA" "--versions=[9.20, 9.20]" for /f "usebackq delims=" %%x in (`%%onecmd%%`) do set sevenzipa=%%x
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.7z') do set setup=%%x "%sevenzipa%\7za.exe" x "%setup%" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt del "%setup%"
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b qt4.*') do set name=%%x cd "%name%" for /f "delims=" %%a in ('dir /b') do ( move "%%a" .. ) cd .. rmdir "%name%"

mklink /D C:\NpackdSymlinks\com.nokia.QtDev-i686-w64-Npackd-Release-4.8.2 "%CD%"
